description.plain:
The Vamps are a British band consisting of members Brad Simpson, James McVey, Connor Ball, and Tristan Evans.

The group was formed when solo artist James McVey wanted to start a band. He found Brad Simpson through an Ed Sheeran cover he posted on YouTube and messaged him on Facebook. They found drummer Tristan Evans through Facebook, and bassist Connor Ball through mutual friends.

Their appropriately named debut Meet The Vamps was released in the UK in April 2014. An alternate version was released in the US the following November, with the difference being added features by Demi Lovato and Shawn Mendes on “Somebody To You” and “Oh Cecilia,” respectively. Both of these tracks, in addition to “Can We Dance” and “Last Night,” were released as singles.

In 2015 the boys released the single “Wake Up,” and the release was followed by both an extended play and album of the same name.

The release of “All Night” ushered in a new era for the four British boys and introduced a new dance-y sound, a change accompanied by a shiny verified account right here on Genius. After putting out “Middle Of The Night” and “Hands,” which featured tourmate Sabrina Carpenter, they released their highly-anticipated Night and Day record.

body.plain:
The Vamps are a British band consisting of members Brad Simpson, James McVey, Connor Ball, and Tristan Evans.

The group was formed when solo artist James McVey wanted to start a band. He found Brad Simpson through an Ed Sheeran cover he posted on YouTube and messaged him on Facebook. They found drummer Tristan Evans through Facebook, and bassist Connor Ball through mutual friends.

Their appropriately named debut Meet The Vamps was released in the UK in April 2014. An alternate version was released in the US the following November, with the difference being added features by Demi Lovato and Shawn Mendes on “Somebody To You” and “Oh Cecilia,” respectively. Both of these tracks, in addition to “Can We Dance” and “Last Night,” were released as singles.

In 2015 the boys released the single “Wake Up,” and the release was followed by both an extended play and album of the same name.

The release of “All Night” ushered in a new era for the four British boys and introduced a new dance-y sound, a change accompanied by a shiny verified account right here on Genius. After putting out “Middle Of The Night” and “Hands,” which featured tourmate Sabrina Carpenter, they released their highly-anticipated Night and Day record.

songs.full_title: Just My Type by The Vamps
songs.title: Just My Type

description.plain: This song was first performed in the Sheffield Arena on The Vamps’s tour. The song is about falling for a girl who is not good for you and then realising that she is your type as your type is falling for girls you shouldn’t fall for. And all she wants is a little fun with the wrong people; she’s falling for the complete wrong guy who won’t do good for her, unlike Brad who is singing that he will.

songs.lyrics:
52 ContributorsJust My Type Lyrics[Verse 1: Bradley Simpson]

But she's not ready for that
[Chorus: Bradley Simpson]

Then gets me high
Oh I don't know why she's just my type
She's bad advice
I don't think twice
Oh I don't know why she's what I like

[Post-Chorus: Bradley Simpson]
But I, I, I love it
I, I, I love it
Love the way she plays with my head
She lets me down
Then gets me high
Oh I don't know why she's just my type

[Verse 2: Bradley Simpson ]
This girl's still on repeat
Plays in my mind, won't let me sleep
She's not the one who's in my sheets
'Cause she's no good
She defies all of my dreams
And expectations she won't meet
I'll pack my bags and try to leave
I wish I could

'Cause I need this more than just a one night stand
Need that honey when she hold my hand
Times like this, they call for true romance
But she's not ready for that

[Chorus: Bradley Simpson]
She lets me down
Then gets me high
Oh I don't know why she's just my type
She's bad advice
I don't think twice
Oh I don't know why she's what I like

[Post-Chorus: Bradley Simpson]
But I, I, I love it
I, I, I love it
Love the way she plays with my head
She lets me down
Then gets me high
Oh I don't know why she's just my type

[Bridge: Bradley Simpson]
More than meets the eye
To tell the truth would be a lie
I saw her out again last night, misunderstood
And I'll never be that guy
That cigarette still needs a light
And when I take her back to mine it's nothing good
[Pre-Chorus: Bradley Simpson & Connor Ball]

Need that honey when she hold my hand
Times like this they call for true romance
But she's not ready for that

[Chorus: Bradley Simpson]
She lets me down
Then gets me high
Oh I don't know why
She's just my type
She's bad advice
I don't think twice
Oh I don't know why she's what I like

[Post-Chorus: Bradley Simpson]
But I, I, I love it
I, I, I love it
Love the way she plays with my head
She lets me down
Then gets me high
Oh I don't know why she's just my type

[Outro: Bradley Simpson]
Oh she's just my type
Yeah she's got just what I like
And she's just my type
Oh yeah she's just my type15Embed

songs.full_title: Hair Too Long by The Vamps
songs.title: Hair Too Long

description.plain: ‘Hair Too Long’ is the 2nd song on The Vamps 4th studio album ‘Night and Day (Day Edition)’. It was the first single, as well as the first music video, put out for this album. In the song, Brad sings about a relationship that he no longer wants to be in with a girl who makes him feel bad about himself and doubts himself. However he can’t end the relationship either, so he decides to try and make her breakup with him by doing things that will annoy and upset her.

songs.embed_content: Read “Hair Too Long” by The Vamps on Genius

songs.full_title: Somebody to You by The Vamps (Ft. Demi Lovato)
songs.title: Somebody to You

description.plain:
“Somebody to You” was The Vamps' first official single in the United States, featuring American singer Demi Lovato, released in the UK on 2014, May 18th. The song is about disregarding all the things other people chase after (fame, fortune, etc.) and focusing on the person that you love. The verses also tell a story where two people who meet and start to crush on each other without the other one knowing.

“Somebody to You” peaked at number 4 on the UK singles chart, “becoming the group’s fourth successive top 5 single in the United Kingdom.” The Vamps' highest charting ever in Australia was also achieved with “Somebody to You”, when the song peaked to number 14. The highest charting of this song in the world was in Scotland, where it peaked at number 1 on the Official Charts Company’s charts of Scotland.

This song didn’t chart the Billboards Hot 100 in America after its release, though their debut extended play (EP) version of “Somebody to You” charted at #10 on the Billboard Top 200.

The single was certified Gold in the United States, New Zealand, and Canada, Platiumn in Australia, and Sliver in the UK.

The official music video shot in Malibu, California premiered on YouTube on June 9th, 2014, directed by Emil Nava, and has reached 142 million views as of 2018.

The first time Demi Lovato and The Vamps performed the song live was on The Ellen Show on November 11, 2014.
